inn1.comm: short of a length, slight nip back in, defended in front of off
on a length, holds its line a touch, 84mph, defended to mid-off
short of a length, middle and leg, 133ks, defended to leg. Mustafizur to Sharma over last six balls: 0 runs, two wickets
pitched up, outside off, Sharma plays a check-drive to cover
short of a length, nips away after pitching on off, beats a defensive poke by Sharma
uppish flick off the pads, but through the vacant region between mid-on and midwicket. Gets three for it
bowls a really slow loosener at 118s, but it is full and only just outside off. Dug out back to him
slow again, at 122ks, but he is accurate, and a cagey Sharma defends it in front of off. You can see the pressure India are under. On normal days, he hits these balls
shimmies down the track to counter the lack of pace, and does it well. Reaches the pitch of the ball, opens the face, and drives it over cover
short of a length, worked to leg, takes a step or two, and then sends Dhawan back. Dhawan makes it back in time, and raises his thumb to tell Sharma it is all right
wide down the leg side
short of a length, on off, he opens the face and the ball is at Sharma's feet when Dhawan scampers up. He is sent back again. Another thumbs-up after he makes it safe
short, no pace, Sharma has an hour it seems to pull this up in the air. Doesn't reach the boundary but this is a safe shot
yorker, surprises Sharma a little, but not quick enough to beat the bat. Sharma keeps it out
short of a length, nips away to beat him in an identical manner to the one that beat Sharma in the first over. It's the cutter again
and now Dhawan will face finally. Another cutter, this time run down to third man for one
short of a length, at off, punched to cover
cutter, comes off slowly, and even though he has strayed onto the pads, he concedes only one leg-bye
cutter again, the ball is not old yet so it is not doing as much as it does when at its best. Sharma runs this down to third man
length ball, gentle pace, pushed straight of mid-on
short of a length, on the pads, and once again Dhawan is early into a shot. This is a slow pitch and strictly medium pace bowlers
lovely shot. Finally adjusts to the lack of pace. This is a length, pitches off, angles away, and he drives this on the up. In the ground it bounces, and then flies over the cover

big appeal for a catch at the wicket. Not given, and Dhawan is a walker. This is an offcutter, which has beaten the edge by a couple of inches, the keeper doesn't even go up. Mortaza is the only one appealing, he doesn't get the decision, and he is not happy with his Litton Das, the keeper, for not appealing
short of a length, straight, pushed to the left of mid-off for one
slower ball, into the pads, worked away for one
short of a length, angling away, easily steered to third man for one. Sharma has now done this to Mustafizur three times in a row
short of a length, just outside off, punched to cover
fuller, driven crisply on the up, but straight to mid-off
that's the cutter, but it is short and it's wide. Cut away to the left of third man for one. Sunny makes a diving save. Surprised they have taken just the one
flicked uppishly off the pads, but falls well short of short midwicket
that's a big mis-hit as Rohit looks to loft this fullish delivery. Not to the pitch of the ball, the pitch is slow, and all that results in an almighty miscue. However, it manages to clear mid-off
flighted on off, defended back to him
Sharma has made up his mind to not let the spinner settle down. Jumps out of the crease and effortlessly lofts a length ball over mid-on
flatter, delivery, stays back to defend. No turn so far
flat still, slightly fuller, defended back to Sunny
pushed to mid-off, and they steal a single. Bangladesh won't be happy with this single. It is hit straight to the fielder, and not softly either
short, nothing delivery on the pads, worked away for a single
half-volley, on off, driven straight to mid-off
short of a length this time, punched away on the walk, but can't beat the man of cover
short of a length, cutting in, punched wide of mid-off. Tamim is slow on his feet, but gets a dive in in the end to save three runs
short of a length, wide, easy pickings for Sharma, who has punched this in front of point for four
regulation pace this time, 135ks, bounces off a length as Sharma leaves this alone. Collected in front of his chest by Das

Mustafizur has got Sharma for the third time this series. A loose shot from Sharma. Just when he had looked like he was starting to pick the cutter early, he goes for a big shot to a wide length ball, which angles away to take the edge. Just not the same alertness as he has shown earlier in the day. A break in concentration. Not good news for India that the batsmen are not concentrating for long enough
short of a length, pretty accurate. Defended back to him
short of a length, on the pads, goes for a leg-bye
short of a length, near the tram lines. Can't drive it, can't cut it. Left alone, but this is the ball to bowl to Kohli. Difficult to execute it, but that should be the plan
Kohli takes the risk as Rubel stays wide and shortish. He punches this away from the body and uppishly but in front of point. A risky shot
stays in that channel, short of a length and wide. Kohli lets this one go. He will be itching to feel ball on his bat
the straighter ball, the change-up, but Kohli is equal to it and drops it to leg for a single
on a length, middle and leg, angling towards off, defended back to him
slower ball, pushed wide of mid-off for one
on a length, angled towards top of off, punched to cover
lovely drive on the up. Dhawan is not to the pitch of a regulation-pace delivery, but he has sent it scurrying between mid-off and cover

pushed to mid-off for an easy single, but Tamim goes for a direct hit, hits the stumps and concedes four overthrows. There is no need to throw really because Dhawan is past the stumps by the time the throw arrives
slower ball, middle and off, defended off the front foot
bouncer, chest-high, pulled away over square leg. Not in control of it, but he has cleared the man
on a length, quick, punched to cover
short of a length, on the pads, punched away straight to square leg
short of a length, no room, pushed to short cover
full toss on the pads, slightly late into the shot, and he gets just a couple past mid-on
short of a length, middle and off, angling away. There is only a little bit of room available, but Dhawan has punched this superbly through cover-point for four. Amazing timing
short of a length, widish, holds its line, and it's called a wide. Slightly harsh in my view
short of a length, outside off, but not too wide, moves across to push this to mid-on for one
down the wicket, push-drives on the walk, wide of mid-off for one
down the wicket to push this to mid-off
tries that wide delivery but is too short, and is cut away to deep point for one
well played as there is no slip in place. This is a slower offcutter, short of a length, just outside off, and he opens the face to get a couple fine of third man
short of a length, on off, pushed to cover-point
full and straight, Kohli moves across to clip it from there to leg side for one
short of a length, slightly over top of off, pushed to cover
short ball, but down the leg side, and Dhawan can go ahead with the hook. Even though he has not middled it, he gets four to fine leg. The line not good here
tucked away off the hip for one to leg
good bouncer, good sharp bouncer, at Kohli's badge. He pulls out of the hook at the last moment. Called wide, though, for height. Sightly harsh, I feel

they are bowling wide to him, Kohli is moving across the stumps to get close to the ball. Flicks this full ball powerfully, back into Rubel, who is hit hard on the right thumb. He gets some attention on the thumb
short of a length, chest high it gets, he has steered this to third man
full and straight, defended to leg
slight shimmy, Nasir fires this in, Kohli defends
full and flat, no turn, pushed to long-on for one
tossed up just outside off, Dhawan uses soft hands and takes a single to cover-point
middle and leg, no turn, flicked to short midwicket

again that offbreak that doesn't turn. Kohli goes back to play it, and it looks awfully similar to the play that resulted in his lbw in the previous match. This time, though, Kohli is equal to it, and works it around the corner for one
wide length ball, Kohli doesn't time the drive well. Finds the man at cover
short of a length, steered in front of third man for two
short of a length, outside off, Kohli moves across to drop this to leg for one
on a length, on off, nicely driven on the up past mid-off, but Mashrafe is guilty of being slow off the blocks there and not putting the dive in
short of a length, straight, deep in the crease to defend this
short of a length, on the pads, dropped to leg for one
flighted, on off, defended off the front foot
loose drive away from the body. No turn from Nasir. Gets the inside edge, but misses the stumps
short of a length, angling in, punched to long-on
straight length-ball, no turn, Kohli is equal to it and takes a single to midwicket

that would have been an exceptional catch. Das has anticipated the reverse lap very well, the ball has come off the face of the bat, but he has failed to hand on to it. That is excellent anticipation, but it just doesn't stick in his gloves
punched down the ground
short of a length, stays back to defend
short, on off, he makes room to cut. Gets a single to point. Fifty for the stand
tossed up on off, holds its line, defended
flighted just outside off, driven to deep cover
down the wicket, not to its pitch, pushes it back to Sunny, who throws the ball back at the keeper, much to the joy of the crowd
short of a length, on off, punched to short cover
short of a length, into the pads, Sabbir's dive at midwicket denies them the single
shimmies down the wicket to find the gap between midwicket and square leg
length ball, on off, angling in, defended to cover
short of a length, on off, punched to cover
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover
lovely shot. Kohli's first boundary today. Down the wicket to reach the call and whips this in the air over midwicket
down the wicket, not to the pitch of the ball, still gets a single to long-off
darted in, goes back to punch this to long-on
makes room, then shuffles back to his original stance, looks to play the sweep, gets a single off the bottom edge
stays back to open the face on a length ball, and Shakib makes a lethargic effort at point to let it go for three runs
wide half-volley, Dhawan reaches out, right to its pitch, drives with an open face, beats cover for a four all along the ground
full, outside leg, and he has swept it away powerfully through square leg. Brings up the fifty
length-ball offbreak, holds its line, defended to leg
flatter, quicker, Kohli goes back to punch this powerfully, but can't beat cover
holds its line in front of the stumps, worked to square leg
overpitched this time, easy to push it to long-on for one
down the wicket, pushes inside-out, but not past Hossain's right hand
darted short of a length into the pads, worked away for a single
short of a length, sits in the surface, can't time this to long-on. Finds short straight midwicket
slightly short of a length, he rocks back to play the cut, but can't beat point
down the wicket, too early into the shot, ends up swiping it one-handed to long-on for one
clipped away off the toe, but straight to short midwicket

tries the big slog sweep, but the slowness of the wily Shakib has done him in. Kohli has not been fluent, but he needs to look at the scoreboard. The team is going at six an over. There is no need to play such expansive shots. He is too early into the slog sweep, and is beaten all ends up. Timbah
darted in, short of a length, stays a touch low, and pretty straight. Dhoni keeps it out
on a length, angling in, defended off the front foot
overpitched, driven to long-on for one
flat length ball, draws a defensive from Dhoni who is shimmying down
fired into the pads, defended to short midwicket
down the wicket to push this to long-on for one
flatter arm ball, angled in towards top of leg, punched towards short midwicket but the enthusiastic Nasir runs across to field himself
short of a length, angling in, defended to leg
yorks himself after coming down. Another huge cheer
arm ball, aimed at top of off. Defended
down the wicket, Shakib slows it down, Dhoni pushes this to short midwicket
teases him with another slow flighted delivery. Defended in front of his body
big lunge forward, defends in front of his body
on a length, flat, defended back to him
short of a length, into the body, punched to leg for one
down the wicket and takes an out-and-out risk. You hardly see people stepping out and hitting fours to square leg. Dhoni has just done that. Slowness of the pitch might be behind this
down the wicket again, and Dhoni takes a more calculated risk this time. Goes over midwicket for a flat six. Dhoni putting pressure on the young part-time offspinner
good comeback from Nasir. Bowls another slow offbreak that doesn't turn and beats Dhoni's outside edge. They go upstairs for a stumping, but Dhoni has not lifted his back foot at all
down the wicket, not quite to its pitch, and checks this back to Nasit
comes down the track to reach the pitch of the ball, gets a single to long-on
short of a length, into the pads, and that is easy pickings for Dhoni. He goes back in the crease, opens up the front leg, and hammers this between midwicket and mid-on
stretches forward to take this flighted delivery on the full, and places this between mid-on and midwicket for three. Good running too. Two of the quickest men in the Indian team at the wicket
full and flat, pushed back Shakib. The ball ricochets off Dhoni, but they are not going to run off those
down the wicket to nicely drive this to long-off
arm ball, on off, angling in, defended back to him
lovely cover-drive. This is a bit of a loosener. A half-volley outside off, and he drives this between mid-off and cover. All along the ground
short of a length, on off, drops this at his feet and takes a single
short of a length, outside off, pushed to cover
offcutter, Dhoni comes down on it hard, and the ball bounces into the ground before going to point
bouncer, Dhoni goes back deep into the crease as he pulls this in front of square for four. Not the quickest of bouncers
full, outside off, pushed to mid-off
swept away to deep square leg for one
short of a length, on off, stays back to defend
tossed up this time, Dhoni stays back to punch this down to long-on
short of a length, wide, easy shot for Dhawan. He goes back to punch this cover-point and extra cover for four
Talukdar, the substitute fielder, makes a diving save to prevent runs
Talukdar dives again but Dhawan has hit this straight enough of him to get a single to long-on
whipped away off the hip for a single to deep backward square leg
down the wicket, square-drives him on the up, gets a single to deep cover
down the wicket, push-drives it on the up, can't beat short cover
slower ball, half-volley, with mid-off up and all Dhawan has to do is extend his arms through it, and place it between Mortaza and mid-off

Dhawan is a touch unlucky. Nasir Hossain pulls off another stunner. Similar to the Rahane catch in the first game. This is a slower offcutter, but this is pitched halfway in the pitch, and Dhawan can hit this wherever he wants to. He chooses midwicket, looks to go over the man, but Hossain is not just a man. He is a plane. He is a bird. He is a fox who has become a tiger. He is superman. He takes the catch at short midwicket
length ball outside off, left alone
driven to long-on for one
slow tossed-up delivery, defended
flatter delivery, hit back to him
down the wicket to send this to long-off for one
tossed up outside off, defended back to him
full, just outside off, driven to long-off
slower ball, 108ks, on a length, outside off, pushed to deep cover for one
short, wide, rises high, but this is the pace of Mortaza and not Rubel, who got him out of a similar shot last match. This time Rayudu controls it to get four through point
fuller, outside off, defended cover
short of a length, on off, stays back to defend
fuller, just outside off, half-forward to defend
full, angling in, driven on the up, but can't beat mid-on
down the wicket, beaten in the flight by a shorter ball, pads it away
lunges forward to defend this fuller ball in front of his body
arm ball, Dhoni is caught back to a full ball. Just about keeps it out
flighted outside off, driven hard but straight to short straight cover
shorter, punched straight to short midwicket
driven straight of the short straight cover for one
slower ball, half-volley, shovelled away to deep point
and Rayudu nearly gives it away after playing all those dots. Looks to drive a shortish ball over mid-on, and has mis-hit it. Bounces short of mid-on
slower ball, shuffles across to take this from off, gets a single to deep midwicket
another slower ball, this time Dhoni finds short midwicket
down the wicket, nonchalantly pushes a shorter ball to long-on for one
short of a length, into the pads, helped away wide of fine leg for two
down the wicket, not close to the ball, mis-hits this and inside-edges it to square leg for one
shimmies down the pitch, pushes down the ground, but can't beat short straight cover
another shimmy, Shakib bowls the flatter delivery, short cover does the job again
this time he stays back to punch it to deep cover
stays back to cut a length ball to deep cover
flighted, middle and leg, pushed to long-on for one
on a length, flat, defended back to him
on a length, angling in, pushed to long-on for one
into the pads, easily worked away for a single
that's an ordinary delivery. Fine leg inside the circle, and he fires this into the pads. Rayudu gets down on a knee, and helps this over short fine leg
on a length, middle and leg, pushed to long-on for one
down the wicket to drop this into the leg side for one
down the wicket to defend this back to Shakib
forward lunge to drop this to leg for one
angling into the pads, gets a single towards midwicket
full and fast, beats the outside edge as Dhoni drives, but this doesn't come up at all and squeezes under the gloves of Das and between his legs for four byes
down the wicket to take this on a half-volley to push this into the leg side for one
on a length, on off, driven to long-off for one
full, just outside off, he moves across to drive this to long-off for one
looks to steer this past third man, but can't beat him. Gets a single
cutter, on off, opens the face, gets a single
slower ball again, Dhoni lunges forward to push this towards midwicket for one
offcutter, Rayudu has no idea about it, he pushes in front of the body, the leading edge flies towards mid-off. The mid-off is back, though
short of a length, on off, pushed towards cover for one
leaves the crease again, pushes a length ball towards deep midwicket for one
half-volley on the pads, clipped away for one
on a length, on off, lunges forward to push this towards long-off for one
down the wicket, takes a length ball on the half-volley, and gets a single wide of midwicket
Dhoni lunges forward, Shakib stays slow, full, provides no room. Dhoni defends this back to him
shimmies down, yorks himself, another dot ball
short of a length, outside off, punched to short backward point
short of a length, just outside off, Rayudu stays back to defend
plays the flick-pull to a short ball, gets a couple wide of deep midwicket
lovely spitting offcutter, against the angle and starts just outside off. Rayudu stays inside its line
another offcutter, Rayudu has no pace to work with. Stays back and defends
short of a length, outside off, allowed to go through. In PP overs. Sign of respect for the young bowler. India 29 for no loss in the Powerplay
gives the fastest bowler in the attack the charge and drives a shortish ball on the up through extra cover for four all along the ground
slower ball, length ball, worked into the gap on the leg side for a couple. Dhoni in his element here
full, angling in, driven straight to midwicket
slower ball, middle and leg, dropped into the leg side for one
short of a length, wide, punched away, backward point puts a dive in to get a hand to it and save two runs. Nasir Hossain is the fielder
slower full ball, Rayudu recovers well to get a single to long-on
on a length, holds its line, defended back to him
nice chip shot after leaving the crease, gets a single to deep midwicket
down the wicket, not to the pitch of the ball, pushes this to long-on for one
leaves the crease again, not to the pitch of the ball, gets a single to long-off
beaten in the flight after leaving the crease, but still manages to turn it around the corner for one. That brings up the fifty, and he hardly acknowledges the applause. In mood for more
down the wicket to chip this to long-on for one
low full toss, almost a yorker, driven to mid-off
low full toss driven to mid-off again
length ball, angling in, he works this around the corner, comes back for two
calculated shot. Length ball, on off, he goes inside-out, and even though he hasn't timed it perfectly he knows mid-off is up. Smart cricket
slower ball, stays back to punch it to deep cover
short of a length, quick ball, 133ks, no room. Defended with an open face
on a length, on off, defended off the front foot
down the wicket, beaten in the flight, swipes across it, gets a single to short fine leg. Dhoni is tired and is hoping the throw doesn't come to his end. It does. But it is not accurate
chips this over cover for one
beaten in the flight as he leaves the crease, gets a leg-bye
technically dropped him. Drilled back at him, it is coming back really fast, Sunny gets two hands to it, only slightly right to him, but the ball hits the fingers and ricochets towards mid-on
single into the leg side
Dhoni leaves the crease, Mortaza sees it and bowls a slower ball, Dhoni drops it towards mid-off for a single
slower ball again, looks to steer this between short third and point, but the slowness means he has hit this straight to point
short of a length, steers it, but can't beat short third man. Mortaza playing with fire by bowling that length with the third man inside the circle
regulation pace, gets it big as Rayudu comes down the track, but the mis-hit clears cover. Only just. Full credit to Dhoni for taking the second despite cramps
he has tried this far too many times. Bowling short with third man and fine leg inside the circle. And this time he goes too straight, and Rayudu gets inside its line to send this past short fine leg
short, pulled to deep midwicket for one
bouncer first up, gloves it away for a single. Clearly late into the pull
short of a length, slower ball, short cover charges in to save a single
yorker, on off, not too quick, Dhoni is behind it, defends it to short cover
slower ball, on a length, pushed past point for one
slower ball, full, driven to long-off for one
that's Wasim Akram but at 115ks. Angling in, landing middle and off, headed for top of off. On the way it takes the shoulder of the bat for a single

if you were under any doubt re the old Dhoni, this will evaporate it. Slower short ball from Mortaza, just outside off, Dhoni doesn't wait for it to come on, he just slap-pulls it straight down the ground for four
short of a length, pushes into the covers for one

Rayudu is really angry. Think he will lose some of his match fee, and he will also have to do with the disappointment of having being sawn off. He moves across the stumps to look to hit it over short fine, Mortaza bowls the slower ball to beat him, and the umpire has given him out caught off the thigh pad. Ball is in Mirpur, bat is in Dhaka, but he has been given out. Rayudu really really angry. Dhoni also seen staring at the umpire
full, on off, defended back to him
Raina special. What a lovely shot. Down the wicket slightly, and chips this length ball over extra cover for four
worked off the pads for one
low full toss, driven to long-off for one
slower ball, on the pads, clipped away for one
slower full ball, dug out to short cover. Raina sends Dhoni back
full and fast, just outside off, Raina looks to steer it, beaten. Half a shout although I thought there might have been an edge there. I am usually wrong by the way
high full toss, and Raina has slogged this over midwicket for another one of his favourite shots. This should have been called a no-ball but hasn't
slower ball, mis-hits the drive, but it clears mid-on and goes for three runs
Raina down the wicket, Mortaza bowls short of a length, he opens the face to get a single to short third man

Mustafizur is everywhere. This time he takes a superb catch off a legcutter. Think this is the first time Mortaza has bowled the slower legcutter today. Dhoni has been picking the offcutter well, but this one he doesn't and gets a massive leading edge that flies towards deep midwicket. Mustafizur comes in from the rope and dives forward to take this inches form the ground
Raina plays in front of his body, slower ball, hits it uppishly by the non-striker for one
dug in short, throat high, he opens the face, gets a single to third man
on a length, pushed to extra cover for one
down the wicket, Mortaza bowls the slower bouncer, he manages to keep it down with the cut for a single
lovely cutter, middle and leg, short of a length, nips away to beat the outside edge. Nearly gets the edge
short of a length, on off, punched to deep point
the man at deep midwicket has misjudged this. raina mis-hits the slog, Sabbir runs from deep midwicket to cow corner, but he has come in too far and has beaten
full and fast, driven down the ground, Mustafizur gets a hand to it. Just the single
slower ball, Binny aborts his slog, he opens the face, places it past point, and runs hard to complete the second
slogs across the line after shuffling across the line, the bowler does him in with the offcutter, but the edge flies over short third man
Raina makes room, Mortaza provides him no pace, he tries to muscle the short ball, gets a bottom edge through to the keeper
that makes a sweet sound as Raina shuffles across to slog a length ball to the left of deep midwicket for six. India need some of these
down the wicket, Mortaza bowls short, he cuts it to deep cover, puts pressure on the fielder, comes back for the second
length ball, on off, driven with an open face for a single
slower full ball, he picks it, drills it hard, but finds extra cover
lovely shot. Raina is down the wicket, Mortaza bowls the yorker, but because there isn't much pace on this, he has time to recover and slice it fine of short third man for four
looks to hit this short ball over covers. Thetre is no pace to work with, and sends it to the fielder on the bounce
slower ball, Raina drops this into the leg side, pushes the fielder deep, and takes a couple. That's 300 for India
slower yorker, Raina makes room to drive, and is beaten on the inside edge

timbah. He has defeated him completely. The ball arrives an eternity after Raina has swung across the line. Beats the slog, hits the stumps. No. 13 for Mustafizur. Equals Harris' record for 13 wickets in three matches in a series, but Harris played three matches in a five-match series. Mustafizur has done this in a three-match series
and he has nearly bagged the king pair. Digs this yorker out to square leg, and gives up the ghost as he is running the single. If the throw hits, Patel is gone by a mile. It doesn't
and he has yet again ended a Mustafizur with a four off an edge through third man. Not in control as he tries to force this over cover. The edge goes between the keeper and short third man
leg-side half-volley, and he flicks it to score more than 1 run for the first time in ODIs
biggest six of the night so far. Patel picks the slower ball, which is right in the slot, having been bowled on a length and on the pads. Patel slogs this over wide long-on, and can afford a smile
down the wicket, beaten by a full ball outside off, Das takes no chances and appeal lest Mashrafe give him another tongue-lashing
yorker, opens the face, gets a single to point
full toss, thigh high, driven wide of long-on for two
yorker outside off, beaten, and it is strange that Binny and Patel don't try a bye

inn2.comm: bouncer first up from round the wicket. Tamik sways out of its line
short, into the body, pulled away with the front leg in the air. Gets a single to deep square leg

chaos. Length ball, doesn't come on, Sarkar drives uppishly, Binny leaps, gets his left hand on to it, but doesn't catch it. Sarkar is caught ball-watching and sends Tamim back but Yadav misfields at mid-on to let him get back safely
short of a length, defended in front of off
yorker, swinging in, dug out to mid-on
full, nearly a half-volley, driven back to him
short, into the body, pulled to deep backward square leg for one
wide down the leg side
short and wide with that field is not on. Tamim short-arms it over point for four. That's a gift
short of a length, angling in, he dabs on it, gets an inside edge on it, but it avoids the stumps
short and wide, he is looking to cut it over the short square field, but the ball doesn't quite come on, and he ends up hitting it to point, but on the bounce
full ball, angling in, beats his flick, hits the pad, but is headed down

Tucker has given him. Tamim is waiting. They are checking it for a no-ball. The pictures are not clear but he might have a bit behind the crease. The lbw call is just as close. I would go ahead and risk it by saying this would have missed the leg stump. This is bowled from round the stumps, short of a length, and seams back in to go with the angle to hit him in front of middle. Also on the knee roll so height could have been an issue too. The umpire thinks it isn't going too far, I think it is
terrific shot. Length ball, angling in, and he has hit a flat six over mid-on. Lovely connection. Languid connection
more languidness to a wide length ball that he has chipped over extra cover
full and wide, but this time he mis-times it and sends it straight to cover
short of a length, 119ks, comes on slowly, Sarkar is looking to to work to leg, but then aborts the shot because of the slowness
slower bouncer, beats his pull
on a length, angling in, defended
short of a length, widish, left alone
on a length, holds its line, defended to leg
bouncer, big bouncer, it is a wide
short of a length, just outside off, defended
on a length, just outside off, punched nicely to cover
short ball, just outside off, mis-hits this pull to deep midwicket for one
slower ball, on a length, into the pads, worked away for one to deep square leg
short, into the ribs, pulled down to deep square leg
teasing little outswinger outside off, sucks him into the drive, takes a thick edge past slip. That's how Binny takes wickets in domestic cricket
length ball, angling in, and he has beautifully driven this between the bowler and mid-off. In the air, but no one has a chance to get a hand to it
that's like Sourav from the other Bengal. This is beautiful. The crowd is in raptures. This is short of a length, wide, and he has punched this languidly and in front of point for four
huge lbw shout, but this is missing leg easily. Similar delivery to the one that got Tamim out, it beats the inside edge but is going down leg comfortably
bouncer, too high, tennis-ball bounce, wide
wide down the leg side this time
another wide down the leg side. That's a hat-trick of wides
slower full ball, goes off the inside half of the bat to mid-on
short of a length, on off, defended from the crease
slight swing away, defended off the front foot
short of a length, outside off, seams away to beat the bat. Good they haven't called this a wide. They are rather harsh on these balls usually
shuffles across to look to pull to leg, but is done in by a slower bouncer, and gets just a leg-bye
bouncer, head high, and he hooks it. Right out of the screws. This crowd is going delirious. Flat six. Taking the wind out of the attack
slower ball, recovers well, opens the face, gets a single
quick, the pace makes the difference. Sarkar is late into the shot, gets a soft edge that falls short of slip
poor bowling with no fine leg. Pitches outside leg, rises hip high, and he has glanced this gracefully for four
on a length, on off, defended off the front foot
on a length, on off, pushed to mid-off
bouncer. Five wides. Dhoni has no chance here. This is poor bowling
uppish. This comes off a little slowly, and hence he is early into the drive. And he has managed to place this between point and cover-point
tucked away off the hip. Yadav is lucky he has not glanced this fine for four
slower ball, defended in front of middle and leg
slower ball, on off, defended with an open face
another slower ball, on off, defended
slower ball, dips on him, he plays away from the body, gets an inside edge to midwicket for one
on a length, angling in, worked to leg for one
slower ball again, on a length, on off, defended to mid-on
flat ball, angling in, defended to leg
flighted on off, defended off the front foot
really slow in the air, Sarkar is beaten but he steps out and kicks it away
flatter delivery, worked to leg for one
down the wicket, beaten in the flight, the ball turns almost past his bat, but the inside edge saves him and gets a single to square leg
nice loop and dip as he pitches this on middle and leg. Defended to cover
on a length, outside off, runs this down to third man for one

slower ball does it for India. Sarkar shows lack of experience. Kulkarni has been bowling slower balls almost exclusively, but he plays for a regulation delivery and toe-ends this length ball to sky this to mid-on
on a length, holds its line, worked to leg
short and wide, cut away to third man for one
short of a length, wide, nicely punched away in front of square with a couple
short of a length, just outside off, pushed to cover
swept away from in front of leg, gets a single to deep backward square
tries the slog sweep. Has picked the right line outside off, but the ball dips, turns, takes the top edge, which falls safely towards deep square
slight shimmy down the wicket, he goes flat, draws a defensive shot
slight dip on him, defended again
he gets away with it here. Das wants the big sweep, the ball dips and falls short of his shot, and then bounces to take the top edge over short fine leg
offbreak, he lets it turn and then pushes it wide of midwicket
short ball first up, regulation pace, and is pulled away to deep midwicket
low full toss, on the pads, he is lucky Rahim has failed to beat deep midwicket
short of a length, on off, he rises with it and defends
on a length, angling in, worked away for one
short of a length, on off, stays back to defend
slower offcutter, beats the inside edge, but is bouncing over the stumps
shapes up for sweep, sees this is not full enough, defended off the back foot

the moment he steps out here you know it is going for a six. There is not an ounce of uncertainty in his approach, and he is neither too far from the pitch of the ball nor too close to it. And then he lofts it over long-on
swept away, off the top of the bounce, gets a single to deep midwicket
tossed up outside off, really slow in the air, defended
shuffles across to sweep this to deep square leg for one
flighted, middle and leg, driven for an easy single
tucked away off the hip for one
on a length, angling in, pushed to midwicket
he is very lucky with this. This is a bouncer at 142ks, he is trying some shot towards mid-on, is late by quite a while, and the thick edge almost goes for a six to third man
Das might have guessed a slower ball is coming and he jumps out of the crease to pull it to long leg
short of a length, on off, runs this down to third man
another bouncer, gets away with the wide call this time. Touch and go on height
flat offbreak, he stays in the crease and works this to leg
slow offbreak, into the pads, worked fine for a single
short of a length, flat, pushed to midwicket
quick flat offbreak, defended again. You can sense he is itching to use his feet or sweep, but Ashwin is not letting him
slows it down but this is not full enough. Worked to leg for one
fat offbreak, helped around the corner for one
that's a poor start. Short, fast, pulled away between deep square and deep midwicket
length ball, into the pads, helped away for one
on a length, middle and leg, worked to leg for one
flat, quick, takes the inside edge, hits the pad
down the wicket to work this to deep midwicket for one
flighted outside off, defended
short of a length, punched to leg, msifelded by Kohli at midwicket
short again, pulled down to long-on
runs this down to third man
punched to long-on for one
length ball, pushed back to him
that's not a good ball. Flat, shortish, with third man inside the circle. Punched into the gap between point and third man
short of a length, worked past midwicket for one
short of a length, cuts it but can't beat point
on a length, just outside off, defended off the front foot
flighted on off, slower in the air, driven but not past short straight cover
into the pads, worked away for an easy single
makes room to try to get past short third, but Patel stays full and fast. Das is cramped up
short of a length, pushed to short straight midwicket
short of a length, on off, no turn, punched to short straight cover
tries the slog sweep to a flat length ball. Is beaten under the bat
short of a length, punched down to long-on for one
uppish shot, chipped down to midwicket for one. Fifty for this partnership

how does Raina do this every time? And what a lovely catch by Dhoni. Pindrop silence inMirpur. Raina pushes one through, Rahim looks to make room and cut it between point and third man, but he has misread the length and gets a thick edge. The deflection is big but the ball has caressed into Dhoni's glove. As good as catches off spinners get
flat outside off, driven to short cover
fired down the leg side, he tries to paddle it, but Dhoni's foot is in the way
full and straight, defended to him
another forward-defensive
pushes this into the off side for one
flat and straight, Shakib defends. A tight over. Will this create pressure?
dabs this wide of short third for one. Dhoni tries one of his cheeky deflections onto the stumps, but they are home
stays back to a length ball. India are excited. But he keeps it out
half-forward this time. Defends
down the wicket to push this back to Ashwin
down the wicket to drive this to long-on
worked into the leg side
nice paddle sweep. Knows Patel darts them in, and he is bowling from round the wicket, almost taking the lbw out of the equation. Just uses his pace here
this time Shakib wants to beat short third but the ball is not short enough
similar ball, similar shot, short third man fields
sweeps this as Patel gives it a hint of air. Gets a single
misses a straight ball. lazy shot. He has just missed a straight ball. Patel bowls as usual in the late 90s, and the bat comes down late to be bowled
tossed up on off, defended back to him
down the wicket, right to the pitch of the bat, gets a single to long-off
short of a length, easily worked away for a single to leg
flatter, subtly quicker than the previous ones, beats the inside edge but it is going down leg
down the wicket to chip this to mid-on for one
quicker length ball, defended from the crease
dips on him, he is not near the pitch of the ball and defends off the front foot
length ball, slog-swept away to deep midwicket
down the wicket, Patel is flat, can't drive him, ends up pushing this to cover
slog sweep, chooses the right line, dragging it from wide outside off, gets four through midwicket, all along the ground
flatter delivery, into the pads, defended to leg
makes room to punch this from off, gets a single
another slog sweep, this time it goes wide of deep midwicket for two
tries the reverse sweep, Raina denies him the pace, and he ends up playing this to cover
looks to pull this but gets an inside edge to square leg
short of a length, turning in, dropped to leg for one
down the wicket to drive this to long-on
sweeps this from middle and leg, gets a single to long leg
low full toss, driven down the ground, and despite there being a long-on in place he has got four. This is just timed, and shows how fast the outfield is. Perhaps it has even quickened with dew
flat length ball, 95ks, stays in the crease to defend
full, on the pads, clipped away in the gap deep on the leg side, and they come back for two
tossed up outside off, defended, but softly and they get a single to the short cover region
lovely shot. It';s beautifully done. Makes room, Patel bowls fast, 100ks, but a half-volley, and he has driven this inside-out for a four. All along the ground
tries the big sweep but is beaten as he has angled this in
another big sweep, this time he connects, and it takes a dive from Rohit Sharma at deep midwicket to keep them down to two
he is safe. Sabbir should go to a casino after the match. He is trying too many big shots, and is getting away with it. Gets a massive top edge on this sweep but clears the keeper comfortably
defended to midwicket

Bangladesh have taken a risk too many. Shakib tries the slog sweep yet again, which is okay with Patel, but Raina's delivery stops a touch and gets a massive top edge. Kulkarni runs in from long-on to complete the catch
short of a length, punched down to long-on for one
short of a length, flat, punched down to long-on for one
short of a length, on off, he makes room and punches this powerfully through cover for four. Bangladesh need to realise runs can come through such shots too
flat, short, pushed to leg
slows it down a touch, Hossain drops it into the covers for a single
on a length, clipped to wide of short midwicket for one
short, wide, with no man patrolling the square boundary on the off side. Cut away for four
tossed up outside off, driven to long-off for one
defended off the front foot
on a length, on off, defended to cover
bouncer, pretty sharp, 138ks, he ducks it
short of a length, on off, he stands tall and pushes this to point
bouncer again, and this time it doesn't get too high. Not even fast enough, and he has pulled this through midwicket for four. Keeps it down really well
Yadav stays short, at 140ks, and this is only chest high. Hossain stands tall, makes room, and he ramps it fine of third man for four
slower short ball, punched to pint for a single
tossed up, middle and leg, defended to off
short of a length, flat, punched to cover
looks to go over cover, the ball turns a little, takes a thick edge, and flies over point for four. The idea was right, and it did the job for him
flat, into the pads, worked to leg for one
tossed up on middle and off, driven to long-off
short of a length, into the pads, worked to leg for one
short of a length, widish, slow, cut in front of square
lucky there. This is a long hop, but pulled straight to short midwicket
slower legcutter, short of a length, he is squared up a touch, but uses soft hands to get a single
slower ball, wide, beats his drive
short of a length, slower again, runs this down to third man for one

slower ball, short of a length, drops it in front of cover for a sharp single. Kohli charges in, runs the sharp single. He is in by half a frame. And as the third umpire sends across the decision, a huge cheer goes around the ground
length ball skids on, sliced towards point
outside leg, and past the bat to the keeper
drops it short, and that is punished, slapped away for four past a diving point
a touch short again, Shabbir defends the ball towards cover and sets off for a quick single
clipped towards midwicket for a single
pitches it short, on off stump, defended back towards the bowler
on middle and leg, worked away towards deep square leg
Binny begins the over with a full ball just outside off, 125kph, driven towards mid-off
pitched up, and that is thrashed over the off side, not very well timed but gets it over extra cover and that dribbles away for four
cute! might have been too cute but Shabbir plays it late, opens the face and gets it just wide of a diving Dhoni, how often do you see Dhoni dive?
slapped towards cover by Shabbir

the mute button has been hit in Mirpur once again, Binny slips in the slower offcutter, Sabbir goes for the drive, but the ball spins in, takes the inside edge before crashing into leg stump, is that the game?
short ball just outside off, past Mashrafe and through to the keeper
on the pads, defended off the back foot towards the leg side
back of a length and on off stump, Nasir skips down the track and pushes the ball back towards the bowler
whipped towards wide mid-on, another dot ball
drags it short as he sees the batsman advance, fires it at the pads as well. Nasir tucks it towards midwicket for a single
on middle and leg, clipped towards square leg, can't beat the fielder
length ball on off stump, blocked back towards the bowler, end of a quiet over from Raina
short from Binny, Nasir whacks that towards midwicket, can't quite get the power to send it all the way to the rope, Rohit has to run across to his left from deep midwicket to cut that off
short of length and outside off, Nasir wanted to power that through the off, one hand comes off the bat as he plays that, can't find the gap near point
pushed to the left of the bowler, Binny stretches his hand to try reach that, but the ball evades him and Bangladesh pinch a single
short of a length ball, 114kph, Mashrafe opens the face as he defends the ball to the off side

in the air, dropped, Binny nearly had another one there, a touch short from Binny, on middle and leg, a leading edge as Mashrafe tries to work that to the leg side, the ball loops towards point, Dhawan starts moving towards it and then loses it in the light, the ball lands well short of him, Dhawan points to the lights, Binny is not amused
a bouncer in frustration from Binny
a good-looking drive, but can't beat the man at cover
flat, short, lucky that he has turned the ball into the pads, denying him the room, but he has still managed to punch this between cover and cover-point
plays around the front pad, straight to square leg
slower through the air, dipping on him, defended to midwicket

Mortaza has played eight dots before swinging off the hip. The pressure is showing as he jumps out of the crease pretty early, and Ashwin continues with a slow offbreak to beat him in the flight and turn it through the gate
full, straight, flat, beats the bat, hits the pad, draws an appeal but is going down leg
short of a length, into the pads, worked away for one
slower short ball, he recovers well to get a single to long leg
short of a length, outside off, defends this to cover
bouncer, just outside off, he drops the wrists and lets this go through to the keeper. Called one for the over
short of a length, just outside off, he defends with an open face. Doesn't look like a batsman with too many shots
short ball again, this time he upper-cuts. Doesn't make a good connection, but clears point
slower ball, on a length, straight, defended from the crease
shapes up for the slow sweep, Ashwin gets this to dip, and he has to change his shot to the regulation sweep. Gets a single
full, middle and leg, worked to leg for one. They get an overthrow too
nicely bowled, slower through the air, Sunny sees he is early into trying to work this to leg, and ends up defending
flatter, pushed back to him
forward-defensive as this is tossed up
stays back to push a length ball to cover
slower ball, into the pads, down the leg side, glanced fine of fine leg. Hossain comes back for the second to keep strike
short of a length, short-arms this to deep midwicket for one
short of a length, outside off, opens the face, finds point
looks to open the face and place this into the off side, but finds the fielder at point again
slower half-volley, pushed to mid-off
short of a length, on off, stays back to push this to mid-off

it's all over now. The last beacon of hope for Bangladesh, Nasir Hossain, is gone. He has seen Sunny is not going to be able to score runs so he knows he has to take the odd risk. He tries to chip this full ball over midwicket, but is early into the shot, and the leading edge off the carrom ball is caught at cover
flighted just outside off, defended off the front foot
short of a length, he stays back to defend
flatter, middle and off, defended
carrom ball. Good to see he using it after the key strikes have been stryck. Sunny keeps it out
stays back to defend a flat delivery to end a wicket-maiden
wide down the leg side
short of a length, outside off, runs this down to third man for one
short of a length, wide, punched to deep point for one
bouncer, Rubel avoids it, ducking under it
short of a length, straight, defended from the crease
slower ball, chipped into the leg side for one
slower ball, on the pads, worked fine for a single
tossed up, pitches outside leg, defended back
swept away, bottom-edges it to fine leg
flighted outside off, driven to mid-off
sweeps across an offbreak, and is beaten
slower through the air, pitches on leg, turning towards off, defended back to him
slightly short, helped away into the leg side for one
short of a length, short, punched back to Patel
slower through the air, half-volley, defended
flatter, stays back to defend
short of a length, outside off, punched back to him
flighted outside off, defended
flatter, quicker, defended back to him
stays back to defend this flat delivery
this should seal the Man-of-the-Match awards for Raina. He flights this outside off, Rubel slog-sweeps this, finds no timing or elevation and holes out to long-on. Raina's best figures
flat delivery, on off, defends from the crease
slower through the air, defended from the crease
lofts this straight, and the mis-hit falls in no man's land
lovely delivery. Really really slows it down, bowls ay 78ks, pitches middle and leg, and turns to beat the edge, and also the off stump
long hop, pulled to short midwicket
no ball. Defended back to him
unlike Kohli he hits the free hit, top-edging it for a catch at midwicket
flat, shortish, pulled away to long leg
chipped over Rayudu's head. Rayudu jumps, but can't get a touch
full, middle and leg, clipped to leg
fired into the pads, goes for a leg-bye
flat, into the pads, worked into the leg side for one
fires this one in, beats the bat, hits the pad, going down leg
into the pads again, Mustafizur plays a pick-up shot even as he falls down, clearing short fine leg
short of a length, straight, defended back to him
slows it down, Mustafizur chips it towards mid-off for one
full toss outside the leg stump, Sunny gets some bat on the sweep for a four. This is Sunny's personal best. Which takes both the batsmen at the wicket to their career best
flights this, middle and leg, looks to work to leg, and is beaten
short of a length, at the stumps, defended back to him
an almighty slog, he is beaten, but the off stump is beaten too

appeal for a catch at the wicket as he is beaten ion the sweep and the ball lobs off the pad into Dhoni's gloves. Raina makes a mock review gesture as he is given not-out. Don't think BCCI will like this
defended this time for a change
there will be no Banglawash. Rayudu fires in a yorker, catches him on the back foot, and gets his wicket
